document.docAuthor: Duarte, Adriane Da Fonseca, Moreira, Grazielle Furtado, Cunha, Uemerson Silva Da & Moraes, Gilberto José De
document.masterDocTitle: Cosmolaelaps Berlese (Mesostigmata: Laelapidae) from southern Brazil, with a new record of a heteromorphic male, description of a new species, and a key to the species reported from that country

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Cosmolaelaps Berlese (Mesostigmata: Laelapidae) from southern Brazil, with a new record of a heteromorphic male, description of a new species, and a key to the species reported from that country

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hypoaspis ( Cosmolaelaps ) guttulata
.—Karg, 1979: 72; 1981: 218; 1985: 236; 1987: 291; 1988: 516; Xu & Liang, 1996: 193.
Cosmolaelaps guttulatus
.—Moreira et al ., 2014: 319.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cosmolaelaps confinisetarum
Moreira, Klompen & Moraes, 2014 : 333
(synonymy by
Nemati & Gwiazdowicz, 2016 : 546
).
Cosmolaelaps guttulata
.—
Nemati & Gwiazdowicz, 2016 : 546
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. ACeguá-RS, Brazil , soil, five females ( 5 MarCh and 26 June 2012 , 20 August 2013 ) and two heteromorphiC males ( 26 June 2012 ), ColleCted by A. da F. Duarte. Rodovia Geraldo de Barros, km 204, São Pedro- SP, Brazil , litter under
Syagrus oleracea (Mart.)
( AreCaCeae ), one male ( 10 August 2000 ), ColleCted by A.R. Oliveira. NúCleo AgríCola Vale Ribeira, IAC , Pariquera-Açu-SP, Brazil , soil under
Bactris setosa Mart.
( AreCaCeae ), one male ( 18 April 2000 ), ColleCted by A.R. Oliveira (deposited at ESALQ-USP).

Description of the heteromorphic male. Diagnosis. Dorsal idiosoma and gnathosoma similar to homeomorphiC male, sternogenitiventral shield with seven pairs of setae ( st1–st5 , Jv1 and Zv1 ); unsClerotised CutiCle with eight pairs of setae ( Jv2–Jv5 , Zv2–Zv5 ). Two pairs of elongate metapodal plates.

Dorsal idiosoma . Dorsal shield 387–415 long and 272–275 wide (at level of r6 ), 314–384 long and 231–280 wide in homeomorphiC male; mostly with transverse elongate retiCules, with 39 pairs of setae, inCluding two pairs of extra setae, and one ( Jx3 ) or two ( Jx2 and Jx3 ) unpaired setae. UnsClerotised lateral CutiCle with seven pairs of setae ( r6 , R1 , R2 , R4–R6 , one UR ). All setae sCimitar-shaped, exCept j1 and z1 , setiform. Length of setae shown in Table 1 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Length of dorsal idiosomal setae of males of
Cosmolaelaps guttulatus (Karg, 1978)
; for homeomorphic males, mean (minimum–maximum); for heteromorphic males, minimum–maximum; *Brazilian specimens, paratypes of
C. confinisetarum Moreira, Klompen and Moraes, 2014
(junior synonym); – = seta absent.

subSubSection.paragraph: UR1 18 (17–19) 28–30 Ventral idiosoma ( Fig. 1 ). Sternogenitiventral shield 240–242 long and 64–70 wide (behind Coxae IV), with seven pairs of setae ( st1–st5 , Jv1 and Zv1 ). UnsClerotised CutiCle with eight pairs of setae ( Jv 2– Jv 5, Zv 2– Zv 5) around anal shield. Length of setae shown in Table 2 . Two anterior lobes of sternogenitiventral shield as sClerotised as remainder of the shield. Two pairs of elongate metapodal plates. Peritreme, gnathosoma and legs similar to those in homeomorphiC male.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Length of ventral idiosomal setae of males of
Cosmolaelaps guttulatus (Karg, 1978)
; for homeomorphic males, mean (minimum–maximum); for heteromorphic males, minimum–maximum. *Brazilian specimens, paratypes of
C. confinisetarum Moreira, Klompen and Moraes, 2014
(junior synonym).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. HeteromorphiC males have been reported for
Cosmolaelaps vacua (MiChael, 1891)
by GwiazdowiCz (2004) ,
C . cuneifer (MiChael, 1891)
by wisniewski (1982) and
C . michaeli (Huhta & Karg, 2010)
by Khalili-Moghdam & Saboori (2015) . In
C . vaccus
and
C . michaeli
, the most distinCtive differenCe between homeomorphiC and heteromorphiC males is the prominent outgrowth in the ventrianal region of the holoventral shield of heteromorphiC males. Additionally, the heteromorphiC male of
C . michaeli
has leg IV distinCtly stronger than the others and with two spur-like ventral struCtures ( Khalili-Moghadam & Saboori, 2015 ), whereas the heteromorphiC male of
C. vacuus
has dorsal shield longer than the respeCtive homeomorphiC male ( GwiazdowiCz, 2004 ). In the
C . guttulatus
heteromorphiC male, the tarsus of leg IV is similar to the tarsi of the other legs and the dorsal shield of the homeomorphiC male is longer [463 (419–535)] than that in the heteromorphiC male [387–415].
